section.title: What is the Agriculture Editor and Location Service?
section.para: The Agriculture Editor and Location Service is a comprehensive open desktop solution for documenting, managing and visualizing geographic livestock herd distributions, individual animal locations, and animal movements within and between premises locations.
The Agriculture Editor and Location Service is a suite of tools that integrates state of the art Geographic Information System GIS technologies with Tracker Premises livestock management information.

section.title: Project Goals
section.para: As livestock markets continue to adapt to customer requirements, more livestock markets will require animal source information to do business. Yet even for producers not facing this requirement, just knowing where animals are located while still on the premises is considered must have requirement.
Making livestock location information easy to document, lookup and easy to electronically inter-exchange is the primary goal of the Agriculture Editor and Location Service project.

The Agriculture Editor and Location Service provide models, editors and services for the creation and management of documents that:
Reference livestock premises to geographic locations
Create associated groups of business related livestock premises within geographic regions
Create named geographical sub-locations within single livestock premises
Locate Animals that have moved to geographical sub-locations within a premises
Locate Animals that have moved to another premises within associated groups of business related livestock premises
Assign animal positions based on visual sighting records or data inputs from industry standard GPS devices
Will serve as the foundation for a full featured distributed livestock Traceability service

section.title: Functional Overview
section.para: The Agriculture Editor is used to create documents that assign Geographical Locations to Livestock premises.

note.para: The Agriculture Editor is dependent on two other Tracker Desktop Features, the Premises Editor and the Geographic Editor. Agriculture documents created by the Agriculture Editor reference elements contained in documents created by these two editors. Geography attributes in the Agriculture documents are references to Container elements in the *.kml documents created by the Geographic Editor. Livestock attributes in Agriculture documents are referenced to Premises elements in the *.premises documents created by Premises Editors.

section.para: The Location Service provides name and geolocation resolution based on the information contained in specially designated Agriculture documents. The Location Service enhances all features containing location derived attributes.

The Agriculture Editor and Location Service Feature adds geographical visualization, location resolution and geographic analytical utilities to the Tracker Desktop Business Intelligence Toolkit:
Simple end user visualization of premises geographies through integration with industry standard Geobrowsers.
Geolocation features benefit all types of producers. For those using electronic automation with GPS and RFID readers and those using manual key entry of animal history events
Desktop editors, views, and utilities for modeling agriculture associations allowing livestock producers auditors, and processors to geographically -
manage internal, inter-association and intra-association animal movements and information flows
create marketing and/or auditing reports for regional and local based farm products
Easily view the location of animals within the local premises.
Resolution of locations based on animal Position events that were input from GPS devices associated with RFID readers. Where Position coordinates determine the location names based on best fit (smallest area) of list of geographically specified locations
Visual sighting of animals with manual assignment of location names selected from list of geographically specified locations
Most current Sighting event or Position event determines location
Easily view the destination of animals moved to other business partners

section.title: Location Service Use Cases
section.para: The Location Service is not directly accessible to the user, but operates in the background to provide geographical location resolution services to the Premises Editor and Premises document related tools. As a background service it resolves location specific elements and attributes within Premises documents, Premises utilities, and Business Intelligence reporting tools.
To provide location resolution, the Location Service derives it's data from one or more of Agriculture documents created by the operator with the Agriculture Editor.

section.title: Agriculture Documents
section.para: The Agriculture Editor enables users to create, transform and edit documents referencing geographic Locations of Livestock Premises and sub locations within a Premises.

note.para: Because Agriculture Documents elements references elements in one or more Premises and KML geographic documents, these two document types need to be created before the user creates an Agriculture document.

section.para: Agriculture document files utilize a .agri file extension to distinguish them from other types of files.

section.title: Agriculture Data Model
section.para: Because all user activity centers around the creation and manipulation of Agriculture Documents, understanding the structure (called the data model) of Agriculture documents is the easiest way to learn to use the information management facilities of the Agriculture Editor.

section.title: Data Model Core Elements
section.para: All Agriculture documents conform to a very simple structure called the Agriculture Data Model. In the Agriculture Data Model, a single Agriculture association is assigned a name and a geographic region. Within this agriculture association there are one or more Location elements. A Location element is a place for assigning livestock premises to geographic locations. The geographic locations assigned to the premises within the Locations may or may not be geographically contained within the Agriculture elements region attribute.

section.title: Loading Additional Resources into the Document

note.para: Since the Agriculture document references Premises document elements and KML document elements, one or more of these document resources must already exist in the workspace.

section.para: To build Location elements in the Agriculture document, the document must first be loaded with the KML and Premsies document resourcess that will be used for the attribute references. To load a resource place the mouse cursor on the root element in the document, right click, and from the pull down menu choose Load Resorce...
From the dialog choose the KML or the Premises document that you wish to load. Repeat the loading process to load all the resources that will be referenced by the Agriculture document.

section.title: Completing an Agriculuture Document
section.para: When KML documents are loaded as resources into Agriculture documents, the editor choice boxes associated with the geography attributes of the Agriculture element and the Location elements will be populated by all Container Features elements from all the loaded KML resources.

Likewise, when premises documents are loaded as resources into Agriculture documents, the editor choice boxes associated with the livestock attribute of the Location element will be populated by all Premises elements from all the loaded Premises resources.

section.title: Agriculture Documents as Input to the Location Service
section.para: The full benefit of declaring premises and geographical locations is achieved when Agriculture documents are defined as input to the Location Service.

In order to assign an agriculture document to the Location Service. The following requirements must be met:
The agriculture document must be a valid Agriculture documents
The agriculture document must be named: doc.agri
The agriculture document must be located in the root folder of a project
The agriculture document must be in a project that has been configured with an Agriculture Nature

section.title: Configuring a Project with an Agriculture Nature
section.para: To configure a project with an Agriculture Nature place the mouse cursor on the Project in the Project Explorer right click, and from the pull down menu choose Add/Remove Agriculture Nature.

figure.title: Configuring Project with an Agriculture Nature

note.para: A project that has been configured as an Agriculture Nature will be designated with a small capital A on the upper right of the project folder icon.
